intro: Pimelea villifera, commonly known as the silky pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a silky appearance. Pimelea villifera is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it contributes to the biodiversity of native plant communities.
